TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CharAnimationUsingKeyFrames extends System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharAnimationBase implements class System.Windows.Markup.IAddChild, class System.Windows.Media.Animation.IKeyFrameAnimation
Public Class CharAnimationUsingKeyFrames Inherits CharAnimationBase Implements IAddChild, IKeyFrameAnimation
type CharAnimationUsingKeyFrames = class inherit CharAnimationBase interface IKeyFrameAnimation interface IAddChild

Docs.summary: Animates the value of a property along a set of over a specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A key frame animation's target values are defined by its <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharAnimationUsingKeyFrames.KeyFrames%2A> property, which contains a collection of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharKeyFrame> objects. Each <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharKeyFrame> defines a segment of the animation with its own target <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharKeyFrame.Value%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharKeyFrame.KeyTime%2A>. When the animation runs, it progresses from one key value to the next at the specified key times.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.CharAnimationUsingKeyFrames> does not accept text as a child, so this method will raise an `InvalididOperationException` unless a derived class has overridden this behavior which allows text to be added.

Docs.param: if this method should simply determine whether this instance can be frozen. if this instance should actually freeze itself when this method is called.
Docs.summary: Makes this instance of object unmodifiable or determines whether it can be made unmodifiable.
Docs.returns: If is true, this method returns if this instance can be made read-only, or if it cannot be made read-only. If is false, this method returns if this instance is now read-only, or if it cannot be made read-only, with the side effect of having begun to change the frozen status of this object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void GetAsFrozenCore(class System.Windows.Freezable source) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub GetAsFrozenCore (source As Freezable)

Docs.param: The object to clone and freeze.
Docs.summary: Makes this instance a clone of the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (but they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values. Note that if these properties contain resource references or data bindings, <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> will fail when trying to freeze the object and will throw an <xref:System.InvalidOperationException>.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> method and should not be called directly from your code, except when calling the base implementation while overriding this method. To create a frozen copy of the current object, call <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozen%2A> instead of calling this method directly.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.GetAsFrozenCore%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override sealed char GetCurrentValueCore (char defaultOriginValue, char defaultDestinationValue, System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock);

.method familyhidebysig virtual instance char GetCurrentValueCore(char defaultOriginValue, char defaultDestinationValue, class System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock animationClock) cil managed
protected: override char GetCurrentValueCore(char defaultOriginValue, char defaultDestinationValue, System::Windows::Media::Animation::AnimationClock ^ animationClock);

Docs.param: The suggested origin value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set start value.
The suggested destination value, used if the animation does not have its own explicitly set end value.
An that generates the or used by the host animation.
Docs.summary: Calculates a value that represents the current value of the property being animated, as determined by this instance of .
Docs.returns: The calculated value of the property, as determined by the current instance.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the `defaultOriginValue` is the first in the composition chain, this value will be the snapshot value (if one is available) or the base property value; otherwise this value will be the value returned by the previous animation in the chain with an <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.AnimationClock> that is not <xref:System.Windows.Media.Animation.Clock.Stopped%2A>.
The `defaultDestinationValue` is the base value if the animation is in the first composition layer of animations on a property; otherwise the value is the output value from the previous composition layer of animations for the property.
